raw_text:
Newcastle to join Morientes race
 
 Newcastle have joined the race to sign Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes and scupper Liverpool's bid to snap up the player, according to reports.
 
 Liverpool were reported to have bid £3.5m for the 28-year-old Spanish international this week. But the Liverpool Echo newspaper has said Anfield boss Rafa Benitez will avoid a bidding war and instead turn his attentions to Nicolas Anelka. Real are believed to still want £7m before selling Morientes. Monaco are also in the race for the player they had on loan last season. Reports suggest Liverpool will lift their offer to £5m - the highest they are willing to go before bowing out of any deal.
 
 On Tuesday, Morientes had said: "I like Liverpool and I am pleased that a club of their stature want to buy me. I have told Madrid that I want it to happen. "Madrid know my situation and they know they must do something about me. They must sort out the situation by being sensible. "I am in a position where I want to play, and I will have to look elsewhere to do that. If Madrid do not want me then it's in the best interests of everyone that they are realistic.
 
 "I haven't spoken to Rafa Benitez but I have always appreciated his work and I would like to play for him. But Benitez could yet turn his attentions to the younger Anelka should Morientes be reluctant to pledge his future to Liverpool. Anelka previously played at Anfield under Gerard Houllier before sealing his permanent switch to Manchester City.
llama3.2:1b: Newcastle joins race to sign Fernando Morientes, but Rafa Benitez will avoid a bidding war and instead looks to Nicolas Anelka. Real Madrid still want £7m; Monaco are also in the running, with Liverpool increasing their offer from £5m to £7m after an initial bid of £3.5m.
llama3.2:3b: Newcastle have joined Liverpool in a bid for Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes, who has expressed interest in joining the club and said he wants it to happen with manager Rafa Benitez. Liverpool had offered £3.5m but are now considering lifting their offer to £5m, while Real want £7m for the player, who Monaco also wish to sign.
gemma2:2b:
Newcastle United is interested in signing Fernando Morientes from Real Madrid.  Liverpool was also reportedly interested and offered £3.5 million, but now seems unlikely to sign him. Newcastle may be able to offer a higher price, while Monaco are also interested. 
Morientes has stated he prefers Liverpool over other clubs due to his personal feelings about the team and its manager Rafa Benitez.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes is joining Newcastle United as a result of Liverpool's bid for him, according to reports. Liverpool are reportedly considering bidding up Morientes' price to £5m, but they have yet to make a deal with the player. Monaco and Anfield both want Morientes' transfer fee and Anelka is believed to be attractive to them in particular.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Newcastle has joined the race to sign Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes from Liverpool, with reports suggesting Morientes will accept a £5m bid. Liverpool's offer of £3. 5m was reportedly rejected by Real. Benitez is not interested in bidding for Morientes, while Anelka remains a possibility if negotiations fail.
qwen2.5:3b: Newcastle has joined Real Madrid's attempt to sign Fernando Morientes, scuttling Liverpool's earlier £3.5m bid. Monaco and Newcastle are also in the race for the 28-year-old Spanish striker. Anelka is another option reportedly considered by Liverpool as their initial offer was raised to £5m. Morientes previously expressed interest in joining Liverpool but indicated Madrid must make a decision about him. Benitez might consider Anelka if Morientes opts elsewhere, given his previous experience at Liverpool under Gerard Houllier.
opencoder:1.5b:
Newcastle, after signing Real Madrid's new player Morientes, plans to join the race and report on the situation. Liverpool reported a bid of around £3.5m by the Liverpool Echo newspaper on Tuesday, suggesting they could possibly sell their existing player Nicolas Anelka. Monaco also appear in the race with a suggested price of £7. Real Madrid are believed to still be looking for a new player to replace Morientes who has been loaning for over 28 years.

Liverpool are hopeful that the offer will rise to a maximum worth of £5m, as they feel they might be able to handle the deal better. Morientes stated on Tuesday: "I appreciate Liverpool's anticipation and believe they may find it more suitable than last season. I have told Madrid they would do something about my situation and they know they must make a decision." Despite his reluctance, Real are also hopeful that their current agreement will continue to be in place.

The club report suggests Benitez could turn Anfield’s attention away from Anelka, as Nicolas Anelka has played at Anfield under Gerard Houllier before signing. They have confirmed that Liverpool are not intending to bow out of this deal, and all players are prepared to move forward.

Real are believed to still want £7m before selling Morientes. Monaco are also in the race for the player they had on loan last season. Reports suggest Liverpool will lift their offer to £5m - the highest they are willing to go before bowing out of any deal.
 
 On Tuesday, Morientes had said: "I like Liverpool and I am pleased that a club of their stature want to buy me. I have told Madrid that I want it to happen. deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to help summarize this text concisely. Let me read through it carefully and identify the key points.

First sentence: Newcastle have joined a race to sign Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes and scurbed Liverpool's bid for him. That seems like the main action here.

Next part: Reports say Liverpool was willing to spend £3.5m but decided against it, thinking of another player named Nicolas Anelka instead. Monaco also wants Morientes, though he wasn't on loan last season. Liverpool might go higher, up to £5m before bowing out or committing a deal.

Morientes has spoken publicly about the situation. He's happy for Madrid and knows they need to make a decision. He's looking elsewhere but appreciates Benitez's work. Benitez could turn his focus away from Morientes if he doesn't want him, and Anelka is another player in that race, though he wasn't on loan.

I should condense all this into a summary without explanations or formatting. Make sure to include the key details about whom they're signifying, the bids, the moves between clubs like Liverpool vs. Benitez, Morientes' comments, and Anelka's involvement.
</think>

Newcastle has joined a race to sign Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes, sc creding Liverpool's bid for him. Reports suggest Liverpool was willing to spend £3.5m but decided against it, focusing on Nicolas Anelka instead. Monaco also wants Morientes. Liverpool might go up to £5m before bowing out or committing a deal. Morientes has expressed satisfaction with Madrid and mentioned the situation, though he's looking elsewhere while appreciating Benitez's work. Anelka is in a separate race, though he wasn't on loan last season.
tinyllama:1.1b: Newcastle have joined the race to sign Fernando Morientes, who is reportedly being targeted by Liverpool and Real Madrid. Despite Liverpool's £3.5m bid for the player this week, Anfield bosses are still keen to lure the Spanish international to Merseyside. Monaco's Nicolas Anelka is also in the fray for Morientes' signature, but it remains to be seen whether he will end up at Anfield or another club. The 28-year-old player, who has said that he likes Liverpool and wants to play for them, has reportedly informed Real of his desire to leave Madrid. However, Real are believed to still want him, and have offered a transfer worth £5m before bowing out of any deal. If Morientes decides to join Newcastle, it's understood that he will need to agree on a switch to Liverpool, with the Anfield side currently in talks with Madrid over his sale.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Newcastle have joined the race for Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes, according to reports. The club is reportedly willing to offer £3.5m and will go head-to-head with Liverpool's bid of £3.5m if the player is sold before next month's transfer deadline. 

Liverpool, however, remain interested in Nicolas Anelka. Real Madrid had previously been keen on the French striker, who has made his feelings about playing for Anfield clear through his actions this season. Anelka's loan spell at Monaco earlier this season didn't do him any good and he was selling himself to potential suitors as a way of staying loyal to the French side. 

Monaco are said to be interested in signing Morientes on loan, with an option to buy if his performance is satisfactory. 

Should Liverpool decide not to match Morientes' £5m valuation, Anelka may become a free agent, and Madrid could make a move for the Frenchman. However, it would be wise for them to wait until Morientes' situation is resolved with Real before moving in, as his current situation at the Spanish club remains uncertain. 

In this race, Liverpool's offer of £3.5m appears to be the strongest and they could have a fight on their hands with Newcastle if Morientes isn't ready to pledge his future to them.
phi:2.7b: Real Madrid is bidding £3.5m for Fernando Morientes and hopes to secure him before Liverpool makes a higher offer. Liverpool are considering Nicolas Anelka instead of Morientes, but will not avoid the competition to sign him. On Tuesday, Morientes expressed his desire to play for Real Madrid but also understood their situation. If he is reluctant to join Liverpool, Madrid should be realistic in their negotiations.
orca-mini:3b: Newcastle have joined the race to sign Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes, scuppering Liverpool's bid to snap up the player. The player was said to have wanted to play for a club of Liverpool's stature, but their offer was not as high as the one made by Real. Monaco is also in the race for the player they had on loan last season. Anelka previously played at Anfield under Gerard Houllier before sealing his permanent switch to Manchester City.
hermes3:3b: Newcastle aiming to sign Fernando Morientes, competing with Liverpool for Real Madrid striker.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Newcastle is reportedly interested in signing Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes, potentially thwarting Liverpool's bid for the player. The 28-year-old Spanish international has expressed that he prefers playing for Newcastle over Liverpool due to his admiration for Anfield boss Rafa Benitez. If Madrid decides not to keep Morientes, Newcastle could be a more likely option for him, with Monaco also showing interest in the player who was on loan last season.

Liverpool initially offered £3.5m but are unwilling to engage in a bidding war, with reports suggesting they may increase their offer to £5m, though Real Madrid seeks £7m. Monaco is also interested in reacquiring Morientes after his loan spell. Morientes has expressed his desire to join Liverpool, urging Madrid to make a decision. However, Liverpool manager Rafa Benitez may shift focus to Nicolas Anelka if Morientes hesitates. Anelka previously played for Liverpool before moving to Manchester City.
stablelm2:1.6b: Newcastle and Real Madrid are involved in a race to sign Fernando Morientes, while Liverpool has been reported to avoid any bidding war by targeting Nicolas Anelka instead. The 26-year-old Spanish international is believed to be seeking £7m from Real Madrid before selling. Monaco is also rumored to be interested. Liverpool had initially bid £3.5m for Morientes but will likely increase their offer up to £5m, with the highest they are willing to go before ending any deal.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Newcastle has entered the competition to sign Fernando Morientes, Real Madrid's 28-year-old striker, reportedly valued at £7m. This move leaves Liverpool, who previously bid £3.5m, out of the race for Morientes. Liverpool is expected to increase their offer to £5m, but may withdraw if Real Madrid does not agree to sell at that price. Morientes expressed a preference for Liverpool but remains open to other clubs, including Newcastle and Monaco (previously on loan from them). He has not yet agreed to a move to Liverpool, indicating potential reluctance or a desire for more assurances from the team. If Morientes is unwilling to commit to Liverpool, Rafa Benitez might consider signing Nicolas Anelka instead.
reference: On Tuesday, Morientes had said: "I like Liverpool and I am pleased that a club of their stature want to buy me.I have told Madrid that I want it to happen.But Benitez could yet turn his attentions to the younger Anelka should Morientes be reluctant to pledge his future to Liverpool.Newcastle have joined the race to sign Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes and scupper Liverpool's bid to snap up the player, according to reports.Real are believed to still want £7m before selling Morientes.If Madrid do not want me then it's in the best interests of everyone that they are realistic.
